metadata.title: CVE-2017-3204 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The Go SSH library (x/crypto/ssh) by default does not verify host keys,facilitating man-in-the-middle attacks. Default behavior changed in commite4e2799 to require explicitly registering a hostkey verification mechanism.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3204` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-go.crypto-dev - 1:0.0~git20170629.0.5ef0053-2
golang-golang-x-crypto-dev - 1:0.0~git20170629.0.5ef0053-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-go.crypto package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:0.0~git20170629.0.5ef0053-2').
snapd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
